text: Neelamperoor Padayani is a Padayani which happens in Neelamperoor Palli Bhagavathi Temple in Neelamperoor, Alappuzha district, Kerala, India. == Origin of the name == The word Padayani means line of infantry. The name Padayani arrived due to the line formation of people like troops. == Mythology == The mythology of Neelamperoor padayani lies with Cheraman Perumal. == History == It is believed that this festival is very old. It has the cultures of Hinduism and Buddhism. Chinese traveller Fa-Hien said this festival resembles a festival of Buddhists in Patna in his travelogue. == Major ceremonies == * Chutteedal * Kudampooja kali * Anujnavangal * Thothakali * Thengamurikkal * Kudanirthu * Plavilanirthu * Makam Padayani * Pooram Padayani == Gallery == File:Kudampooja.jpg|Kudampooja kali File:Thotha.jpg|Thothakali File:Thengamuri.jpg|Thengamurikkal File:Plavila.jpg|Plavilanirthu File:Vela.JPg|Velakali File:Ampalakkotta.jpg|Ambalakkotta File:Padayanimain.jpg|Pooram Padayani == References == Category:Festivals in India Category:Kerala
